title: Address-Book Tutorial - Failed to Install Dependencies
body:
### I'm using React Router as a...

framework

### Reproduction

I am not an experience node or react dev, but I do have some understanding of how it all works and basic related skills. I had these issues on my Macbook Pro and thought maybe it was just something on my machine. So I grabbed the official and latest node docker image and tried it there, it failed there as well. 

terminal/shell
1. docker pull node
2. docker image `docker run --name rrv7 -it --rm node`
3. Exec tab on docker desktop or connect from shell `docker exec -it rrv7 sh'
4. cd /usr/src
5. from tutorial instructions
6. `npx create-react-router@latest --template remix-run/react-router/tutorials/address-book`
7. "y' to process, "y" to default folder name, "y" to new git, "y" to install dependencies

![CleanShot docker exec -it rrv7 sh2024-12-25 at 16 25 45](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b53b2158-aa2c-44bf-a501-a64afbb1c04e)



### System Info

```shell
`from the actual docker node container`
System:
    OS: Linux 6.10 Debian GNU/Linux 12 (bookworm) 12 (bookworm)
    CPU: (12) arm64 unknown
    Memory: 6.97 GB / 7.65 GB
    Container: Yes
    Shell: 5.2.15 - /bin/bash
  Binaries:
    Node: 23.5.0 - /usr/local/bin/node
    Yarn: 1.22.22 - /usr/local/bin/yarn
    npm: 10.9.2 - /usr/local/bin/npm
```


### Used Package Manager

npm

### Expected Behavior

install dependencies for the address-book tutorial

### Actual Behavior

failed to install dependencies
